snippet: Authorities widen the search area after suspected debris and an oil slick turn out to be unconnected to a Malaysia Airlines flight that vanished Saturday night.
abstract: Mystery of missing Malaysia Airlines Flight MH370 deepens when sweeping search fails to find any sign of the plane near its last known location; search, from ships, planes and helicopters from nine nations, is set back by number of false leads that seem to underline how little investigators know about the progress of the flight.

byline.original: By THOMAS FULLER, KEITH BRADSHER and MATTHEW L. WALD
byline.contributor: Thomas Fuller reported from Sepang, Keith Bradsher from Hong Kong, and Matthew L. Wald from Washington. Eric Schmitt contributed reporting from Washington, and Poypiti Amatatham from Bangkok.

lead_paragraph: Authorities widen the search area after suspected debris and an oil slick turn out to be unconnected to a Malaysia Airlines flight that vanished Saturday night.

headline.main: False Leads Set Back Search for Malaysian Jet
headline.print_headline: False Leads Set Back Search for Malaysian Jet
